page.title: 08THE BATTLE OF FLOWERS
page.content: The {Battle Of Flowers}is a carnival which 40,000 people come to Jersey to see every year. {Clubs and societies}construct great floats which are made of millions of flowers. A{special visitor}comes each year to open the carnival. The first ever Battle of Flowers was held in 1902 along {Victoria Avenue.} It was held in celebration of {King {Edward VII'S Coronation.}After this,the Battle has been held every year except during the two World Wars. In the early days of the floats, Â£15 was the maximum prize money, now it costs thousands of pounds to put on. It is called the Battle Of Flowers because years ago the floats were attacked at the end of the parade and people threw the flowers at each other. Now the parade ends with a fire work display.
